itemListElement.name: Tempeh Cauliflower Butternut in Teriyaki Sauce – Date Sweetened

@graph.name: Tempeh Cauliflower Butternut in Teriyaki Sauce - Date Sweetened
@graph.description: Tempeh Cauliflower Butternut in Teriyaki Sauce. This teriyaki sauce is date sweetened and works amazingly with butternut squash and vegetables. Vegan Gluten-free Recipe
recipeIngredient: 9  large medjool dates soaked in hot water for 15 minutes
1 tbsp or more maple or coconut sugar if needed
8 oz tempeh (cubed and steamed, or use Tofu)
1/2  head of a small cauliflower chopped into small florets (or use broccoli)
1  loaded cup chopped butternut squash or other squash

recipeInstructions.text: Soak the dates if you haven't. Steam the tempeh for 10 minutes or boil for 10 minutes. Drain and keep aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Soak the dates if you haven't. Steam the tempeh for 10 minutes or boil for 10 minutes. Drain and keep aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F / 220ºc. Chop up the squash and cauliflower. Spray oil on the veggies, place on parchment and bake at 425 degrees F / 220ºc for 15 to 20 minutes or al dente. Or you can steam the veggies, or boil with the tempeh until just about done.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F / 220ºc. Chop up the squash and cauliflower. Spray oil on the veggies, place on parchment and bake at 425 degrees F / 220ºc for 15 to 20 minutes or al dente. Or you can steam the veggies, or boil with the tempeh until just about done.

recipeInstructions.text: Drain the dates and blend with the other sauce ingredients until smooth. Pour the sauce into a skillet over medium heat. Add tempeh, roasted cauliflower and butternut squash. Cover and cook for 4 to 5 minutes, or until the sauce comes to a good boil. Carefully Taste and adjust sweet and salt in the sauce. If the sauce is not sweet enough, add maple or coconut sugar or other sweetener. Continue to simmer over low heat for a few minutes or until the vegetables are done to preference and the sauce has thickened. Take off heat and let it sit for 5 minutes before serving. The sauce will continue to thicken as it cools.
recipeInstructions.name: Drain the dates and blend with the other sauce ingredients until smooth. Pour the sauce into a skillet over medium heat. Add tempeh, roasted cauliflower and butternut squash. Cover and cook for 4 to 5 minutes, or until the sauce comes to a good boil. Carefully Taste and adjust sweet and salt in the sauce. If the sauce is not sweet enough, add maple or coconut sugar or other sweetener. Continue to simmer over low heat for a few minutes or until the vegetables are done to preference and the sauce has thickened. Take off heat and let it sit for 5 minutes before serving. The sauce will continue to thicken as it cools.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve over rice/ grains of choice with a garnish of toasted sesame seeds and green onions.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve over rice/ grains of choice with a garnish of toasted sesame seeds and green onions.
